results.title: Lottie Lyell
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings Australian history to life. Lottie Lyell was one of Australia’s most successful actresses. Although she often played the damsel in distress in her early films, Lottie was no helpless heroine in real life. As well as starring in her films, she worked behind the cameras as script writer, art director, costume designer, editor and business manager. She was part of an excellent team with Raymond Longford, Australia’s best known silent film director with whom she had a long and enduring relationship.

results.title: Errol Flynn
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings Australian history to life. Errol Flynn’s natural charm and good looks saw him become a screen legend as Hollywood’s greatest swashbuckling lover and matinee idol. This film takes an irreverent look at the nineteen year old Flynn’s escapades in Sydney as he sets off on the path to notoriety.

results.title: Contradictions
results.creator_credit: David Knaus, Janet Bell, Film Australia and Knaus Films
results.brief_description: This film by award-winning cinematographer David Knaus is a very powerful story about the contradictory perceptions and roles of Americans in relation to the war in Nicaragua. It begins with the Congressional Hearings of the infamous Lt. Colonel “Ollie” North. It includes interviews with Comandante Tomas Borge, Nicaragua’s Minister for the Interior and comments from an ex-CIA agent and contra army commanders. Yet the core of “Contradictions” is the story of the ordinary citizens themselves. Nicaraguans wearied by the interference; U.S. citizens who feel they must take responsibility for the “War Crimes” of their administration. This is an important film and should be seen by anyone interested in Central America and recent American history and foreign policy. It won Best Foreign Film at the 1988 Cuban Film Festival.

results.title: Backstage at the Kirov
results.brief_description: The splendour of ballet is for so many a world of dreams and miracles. This movie invites us to be part of the passion and dedication blended with the grinding agony of training and rehearsal at the backstage of the famous Kirov Theatre in Leningrad.
results.description: The splendour of ballet is for so many a world of dreams and miracles. This movie invites us to be part of the passion and dedication blended with the grinding agony of training and rehearsal at the backstage of the famous Kirov Theatre in Leningrad.

results.title: Dance Dans Tanz Danse
results.brief_description: Founded in 1926 by Marie Rambert, Rambert Dance Company is one of dance’s most consistently innovative and imaginative companies. Here are three modern dances by the company featuring music by Bill Withers. The three are: “Lonely Town, Lonely Street” a jazz ballet which conveys a picture of lonely people in a large city; “Intimate Pages” using Janacek’s Second String Quartet; and “Sergeant Early’s Dream” recalling the folklore of the old world with British, Irish and American folk songs. Rated: G

results.title: Eat,Sleep and Cycle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1976 Olympic Films”.
Riders from all over the world competed in this bicycle Marathon from Brisbane to Sydney. All the grit, determination and endurance of the riders is captured in this film. Rated: G

results.title: Harder than Everest
results.brief_description: Of the ten Himalayan expeditions I’ve been on, climbing Mt Gasherbraum IV was the most challenging and spectacular - it was harder than Everest. These are the words of Tim Macartney-Snape, one of a group of seven climbers who actually made it to the summit and shot the entire experience on film at the same time. A spectacular and inspiring video about human achievement.

results.title: Don't be the last to know
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Film Australia and Aviva Ziegler
results.brief_description: Introduced by Mike Willesee - this video provides an in-depth look at two Australian families and their fight against drug addiction. Typical families with day to day problems like everyone else - until a serious drug problem surfaced. Addicts and their families speak frankly about their frustration, confusion and the courage needed to fight back. Essential viewing for all parents.

results.title: Fair play
results.creator_credit: Susan Lambert, Janet Bell and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Australian women cricketers are the undisputed world-cup cricket champions in a sport which is hotly contested by nine affiliated countries. This film follows their latest tour to England to play on the hallowed grounds at Lords.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Susan Lambert, Janet Bell and Film Australia

results.title: Ageing in the new age compilation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
This is a compilation of a series of seven films which examine the issue of ageing in our society. “Hitting a brick wall” is an introductory video; “Under one roof” looks at societies where several generations live under one roof; “With minimal help” is about the Independent Living Centre which offers advice and services to assist the elderly to remain living at home; “The Other side of the coin” examines the issues of pensions; “The Nest egg” is a dramatised film of the options for superannuation; “Reaching out” is about Spain - a co-operative of retired people; “Out of sight” is about Alzheimer’s Disease.
